title: Trump raises US tariffs on South Korea imports to 25%
byline: US President Donald Trump has announced he is raising tariffs on South Korean imports to 25% after accusing Seoul of “not living up” to a trade deal reached last year.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa summoned to FCID
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s wife, Shiranthi Rajapaksa, has been summoned to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID).

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers may occur in North-central and Eastern provinces, today (27), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa seeks two weeks’ time to appear before FCID
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s wife, Shiranthi Rajapaksa, who was summoned to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today (27), has informed that she is unable to do so due to personal reasons.

title: Sly Dunbar, prolific legend of reggae, dies aged 73
byline: Reggae legend Sly Dunbar, who played with everyone from Bob Marley to The Rolling Stones, has died at the age of 73.

title: Radiologic technologists to launch island-wide strike tomorrow
byline: The Government Radiologic Technologists’ Association (GRTA) has decided to launch an island-wide continuous strike in government hospitals starting from 8:00 a.m. tomorrow (28).

title: 84 arrested last year over bribery allegations – CIABOC
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) says that a total of 84 individuals have been arrested in 2025 for accepting bribes.

title: President to inaugurate ‘Godanagamu Adhishtanaye Sanhinda’ national programme today
byline: To rapidly restore religious sites damaged by Cyclone Ditwah and make them available for worship and other religious activities, the government will launch the national programme “Godanagamu Adhishtanaye Sanhinda”, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (27), the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: 30 people dead from effects of winter storm as more freezing cold pummels US
byline: Many in the U.S. faced another night of below-freezing temperatures and no electricity after a colossal winter storm heaped more snow Monday on the Northeast and kept parts of the South coated in ice. At least 30 deaths were reported in states afflicted with severe cold.

title: Woman Police Constable arrested with heroin in Badulla
byline: A Woman Police Constable attached to the Badulla Police Divisional Crime Detective Bureau (DCDB) has been arrested by the Ambagasduwa Police while in possession of 04 grams and 200 milligrams of heroin, police said.

title: France’s National Assembly approves banning under-15s from social media
byline: France’s National Assembly on Monday backed legislation to ban children under 15 years old from social media on Monday, amid growing concerns about online bullying and mental health risks.

title: Former Minister P. Harrison appears before FCID
byline: Former Minister P. Harrison has appeared before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) at around 8:45 a.m. today (27).

title: India, EU finalise landmark trade deal, PM Modi says
byline: India and the European Union have finalised a landmark trade deal, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Tuesday, as the two sides seek to hedge against fickle ties with the U.S..

title: WhatsApp is not secure: Elon Musk comes after Meta in latest X post
byline: Billionaire Elon Musk took to X to slam Meta’s WhatsApp after whistleblowers said private chats on the messaging platform can be read by the company, despite promises of end-to-end encryption.

title: Travel Photographer of the Year 2025: Snapshot of Sri Lankan boy named People’s Choice Winner
byline: After more than 20,000 entries, a panel of international experts has selected the best images in the world of travel photography over the past 12 months.

title: India-EU “Mother Of All Deals” will boost manufacturing, support services: PM Modi
byline: As India and the European Union (EU) move closer to finalising a landmark free-trade agreement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the move, saying the trade pact will boost the manufacturing sector and support services between two of the largest economies.

title: Dr. Rukshan Bellana leaves CID after recording statement
byline: Former Acting Deputy Director of the National Hospital of Colombo, Dr. Rukshan Bellana has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Violent attack on school teacher in Oddamavadi caught on CCTV camera
byline: CCTV footage has captured a violent attack on a teacher using a sharp weapon at a school in the Oddamavadi area, within the Valaichenai Police Division.

title: Six police officers arrested for assaulting Catholic priest interdicted
byline: The six police officers attached to the Gampaha Police Divisional Crime Detective Bureau (DCDB), who were arrested and later remanded for allegedly assaulting a Catholic priest, have been interdicted, Sri Lanka Police said.

title: Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp to trial premium subscriptions
byline: Technology giant Meta is set to trial premium subscriptions for Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp users in the coming months in its latest experiment with paid services.

title: Substandard coal imports affect electricity generation; Experts urge Kelanitissa plant activation
byline: The Kelanitissa Combined Cycle Power Plant should be operated in order to compensate for the electricity generation loss suffered by the national power grid due to the importation of substandard coal, energy experts have stated.

title: Denmark and Greenland prime ministers to visit Berlin and Paris
byline: The prime ministers of Denmark and Greenland said on Tuesday they will visit Berlin and Paris to shore up support amid U.S. President Donald Trump’s recent threats against the Arctic island.

title: Probe on release of 323 containers from Colombo Port without inspection to conclude within three months
byline: The Select Committee of Parliament appointed to look into and report to Parliament on the controversial release of 323 containers from the Colombo Harbour without undergoing mandatory inspection has decided to meet every Wednesday.

title: Heated situation between police and protesters in front of Presidential Secretariat
byline: A tense situation has arisen between police and a group of individuals staging a satyagraha in front of the Presidential Secretariat.

title: China cancels flights on 49 routes to Japan amid renewed travel warnings
byline: China has cancelled all scheduled flights on 49 air routes with Japan as the Chinese foreign ministry reiterated travel warnings, urging citizens to avoid visiting Japan, especially during the upcoming Chinese New Year holiday.

title: Aswesuma Jan. allowance to be credited to beneficiaries’ accounts tomorrow
byline: The January allowance for beneficiaries who qualified for the first and second phases of the Aswesuma program, as well as the January elderly allowance applicable under both phases, will be deposited into the bank accounts of the beneficiaries, tomorrow (28), the Ministry of Finance has announced.

title: Police inspect 65 vehicles in Ginigathhena, 12 suspended for safety violations
byline: A vehicle inspection operation targeting traffic passing through Ginigathhena town was carried out last evening (26) with the participation of the Nuwara Eliya District Chief Motor Traffic Inspector and police.

title: President launches ‘Godanagamu Adhishtanaye Sanhinda’ national programme
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that a special authority will be established this year to ensure the protection of the Central Highlands.

title: Australian heatwave fans bushfires, towns evacuated, Melbourne endures hottest day in 17 years
byline: A major heatwave across Australia’s southeast stoked bushfires, forced hundreds of residents in rural towns to evacuate and brought record-breaking temperatures, with Melbourne recording its hottest day in nearly 17 years.

title: A boat carrying 25 French tourists capsized off the Omani coast, three killed
byline: Three French tourists were killed when a boat capsized off the coast of Oman, the Omani police said on Tuesday in a post on X.

title: Chief Prelates urge appointment of permanent Auditor General
byline: Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiriya Chapters have expressed concern over the prolonged delay in appointing a permanent Auditor General, warning that the post which remained vacant for nearly eight months has led to attempts by certain parties to create disputes over state financial management.

title: Nipah virus outbreak in India triggers Asia airport screenings
byline: An outbreak of the deadly Nipah virus in India’s West Bengal state has sparked concern in parts of Asia, with some tightening screening measures at airports.

title: SLBFE aims to send 310,000 workers for foreign employment in 2026
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), operating under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, has announced a target to deploy 310,000 Sri Lankan workers for overseas employment in 2026.

title: Police highlight growing drug abuse among schoolchildren
byline: Police are maintaining close surveillance over the prevalence of drug abuse among schoolchildren, the Police Media Spokesperson, Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler has stated.

title: Radiologic Technologists temporarily suspend planned strike
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists’ Association has decided to temporarily suspend the indefinite strike that was scheduled to commence tomorrow (28) across all hospitals in the country.

title: Individual staging hunger strike opposite Presidential Secretariat hospitalized
byline: An individual engaged in a hunger strike staged by a group of Development Officers in front of the Presidential Secretariat, demanding permanent employment, has been hospitalized.

title: Court informed ‘Keselwatte Dinusha’ is being held under detention orders
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court was informed today that organized criminal ‘Keselwatte Dinusha’ is currently being held under detention orders for questioning.

title: Govt allocated additional Rs. 220 bln to facilitate public sector salary increase – Minister
byline: The government has had to allocate an additional Rs. 220 billion in 2026 to fund basic salary increases granted to doctors and the entire public service, Cabinet Spokesperson and Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: FCID records statement from ex-Minister P Harrison
byline: Former Minister P. Harrison has recorded a statement with the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID).

title: SOC requests quality reports on imported coal consignments in 3 vessels
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee (SOC) on Infrastructure and Strategic Development has reviewed matters relating to coal imported to Sri Lanka with particular focus on quality assurance and import procedures.

title: Ratnapura logs highest temperature
byline: The highest temperature in the country today (27) was recorded from the Ratnapura Meteorological Station at 34.7°C, the Department of Meteorology noted.

title: Myanmar steps up Nipah virus monitoring, issues travel health advisory
byline: Myanmar’s Ministry of Health has strengthened monitoring measures for the Nipah virus and issued health advice for travelers, despite no confirmed cases being detected in the country to date, according to the ministry’s statement released on Tuesday.

title: Victoria Beckham honoured in Paris amid family rift
byline: Victoria Beckham escaped the bitterness of a family feud with a trip to Paris on Monday to receive an award from the culture ministry for her contribution to the fashion and entertainment industries.

title: Netherlands, Sri Lanka hold discussions to strengthening bilateral ties
byline: A high-level discussion has been held to explore avenues to further strengthen the long-standing bilateral relations between Sri Lanka and the Netherlands.

title: Sri Lanka must be developed socially and culturally: President
byline: The foremost responsibility of any government is to look after the people and that the present government has already begun fulfilling this duty by ensuring that all economic benefits achieved as a nation flow to the people and society at large, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated.

title: Cabinet Spokesman explains reason behind Parliament Deputy Secretary General’s suspension
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa today (27) detailed the reasons behind the suspension of the Deputy Secretary General of Parliament and Chief of Staff, Chaminda Kularatne from his post.

title: 28-year-old man dies in Ambalangoda shooting
byline: A 28-year-old man has died after being shot during a private party held in the Tsunamiwatta in Ambalangoda, police stated.

title: Individual injured in shooting reported in Ambalangoda
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Ambalangoda, police stated.

title: Three-month rehabilitation programme proposed for drug addicts
byline: Sri Lanka has launched a voluntary drug rehabilitation program with vocational training support to help people addicted to narcotics recover and reintegrate into the workforce, the Commissioner General of Rehabilitation Brigadier M. S. Amith has stated.

title: Some members of drug trafficking networks willing to surrender – Dy Minister Watagala
byline: Certain individuals involved in drug trafficking networks have expressed willingness to surrender, according to Deputy Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Sunil Watagala.

title: Anuradhapura DS clarifies reports on inability to cash compensation cheques issued after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A clarification has been issued regarding reports claiming that compensation cheques issued for houses that were destroyed by Cyclone Ditwah cannot be encashed.
